meanings.definition: To withstand the action or effect of
meanings.sent1: The strong walls could resist the wind's force.
meanings.sent2: The umbrella can resist the rain.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's cape could resist even the strongest gusts of wind.
meanings.sent4: Her resolve to resist temptation was as solid as a rock.
meanings.sent5: The armor was designed to resist any attack.

meanings.sent1: She tried to resist eating the tempting chocolate cake.
meanings.sent2: It's hard to resist the urge to check your phone constantly.
meanings.sent3: He had to resist the temptation to press all the buttons in the elevator.
meanings.sent4: The child tried to resist the temptation of opening the present early.
meanings.sent5: Resist the temptation to peek before Christmas morning!

meanings.sent1: The team will resist their opponents with all their might.
meanings.sent2: She had to resist the urge to give up during the marathon.
meanings.sent3: The little engine that could resist the steep hill.
meanings.sent4: He had to resist the strong current while swimming in the river.
meanings.sent5: The plants will resist the harsh weather conditions.

meanings.sent1: The protestors will resist the new law.
meanings.sent2: The tree roots can resist the force of the storm.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to resist the bath by clinging to the edge of the tub.
meanings.sent4: The old building managed to resist the earthquake.
meanings.sent5: The team will resist the opponent's attacks in the game.

meanings.definition: To refuse to accept or comply with
meanings.sent1: She will resist the unfair treatment at work.
meanings.sent2: The workers decided to resist the company's new policy.
meanings.sent3: The students will resist the strict rules imposed by the teacher.
meanings.sent4: The community chose to resist the construction of the new highway.
meanings.sent5: The citizens will resist any attempts to limit their freedom.
